main event: On 28 SEP 1956, a bright metallic object was observed in the western sky for 5-10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as round or oblong and bright metallic gold., The observation was made with the naked eye before the object passed out of sight directly overhead., The sighting lasted for only 5-10 seconds., The report included observations made by multiple personnel., No photographs were included in the report.
witness description: Captain William A. Yonkers, seconded by 2nd Lt. Ronald D. Cooper
